Title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
Plot: After discovering a mysterious artifact buried beneath the lunar surface, mankind sets off on a quest to find its origins with help from intelligent supercomputer HAL 9000.

Title: 12 Angry Men
Plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.
Awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 16 wins & 8 nominations.

Title: 25th Hour
Plot: Cornered by the DEA, convicted New York drug dealer Montgomery Brogan reevaluates his life in the 24 remaining hours before facing a seven-year jail term.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 4 wins & 14 nominations.

Title: A Most Wanted Man
Writer: Andrew Bovell (screenplay), John le Carré (novel), Stephen Cornwell (additional writing)
Plot: A Chechen Muslim illegally immigrates to Hamburg, where he gets caught in the international war on terror.

Title: Adaptation.
Plot: A lovelorn screenwriter becomes desperate as he tries and fails to adapt 'The Orchid Thief' by Susan Orlean for the screen.

Title: American Beauty
Plot: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

Title: American Psycho
Writer: Bret Easton Ellis (novel), Mary Harron (screenplay), Guinevere Turner (screenplay)
Plot: A wealthy New York City investment banking executive, Patrick Bateman, hides his alternate psychopathic ego from his co-workers and friends as he delves deeper into his violent, hedonistic fantasies.

Title: Amores Perros
Plot: A horrific car accident connects three stories, each involving characters dealing with loss, regret, and life's harsh realities, all in the name of love.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 54 wins & 22 nominations.

Title: American History X
Plot: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 13 nominations.

Title: Anomalisa
Plot: A man crippled by the mundanity of his life experiences something out of the ordinary.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 24 wins & 72 nominations.

Title: Army of Darkness
Plot: A man is accidentally transported to 1300 A.D., where he must battle an army of the dead and retrieve the Necronomicon so he can return home.

Title: Bad Taste
Writer: Peter Jackson, Tony Hiles (additional material), Ken Hammon (additional material)
Plot: The population of a small town disappears and is replaced by aliens that chase human flesh for their intergalactic fast-food chain.

Title: Big Fish
Plot: A frustrated son tries to determine the fact from fiction in his dying father's life.

Title: The Big Lebowski
Plot: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

Title: Black Swan
Writer: Mark Heyman (screenplay), Andres Heinz (screenplay), John J. McLaughlin (screenplay), Andres Heinz (story)
Plot: A committed dancer struggles to maintain her sanity after winning the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake".

Title: Blade Runner
Writer: Hampton Fancher (screenplay), David Webb Peoples (screenplay), Philip K. Dick (novel)
Plot: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space, and have returned to Earth to find their creator.
Language: English, German, Cantonese, Japanese, Hungarian, Arabic
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 11 wins & 16 nominations.

Title: Clerks
Plot: A day in the lives of two convenience clerks named Dante and Randal as they annoy customers, discuss movies, and play hockey on the store roof.

Title: Closer
Plot: The relationships of two couples become complicated and deceitful when the man from one couple meets the woman of the other.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 21 wins & 47 nominations.

Title: A Clockwork Orange
Plot: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.
Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 9 wins & 19 nominations.

Title: Coffee and Cigarettes
Plot: A series of vignettes that all have coffee and cigarettes in common.

Title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
Writer: Du Lu Wang (book), Hui-Ling Wang (screenplay), James Schamus (screenplay), Kuo Jung Tsai (screenplay)
Plot: A young Chinese warrior steals a sword from a famed swordsman and then escapes into a world of romantic adventure with a mysterious man in the frontier of the nation.

Title: Dead Alive
Writer: Stephen Sinclair (story), Stephen Sinclair (screenplay), Fran Walsh (screenplay), Peter Jackson (screenplay)
Plot: A young man's mother is bitten by a Sumatran rat-monkey. She gets sick and dies, at which time she comes back to life, killing and eating dogs, nurses, friends, and neighbors.
Website: http://for an abundance of outrageous gore

Title: Das Experiment
Plot: N/A

Title: Death Proof
Plot: Two separate sets of voluptuous women are stalked at different times by a scarred stuntman who uses his "death proof" cars to execute his murderous plans.

Title: Django Unchained
Plot: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.

Title: Donnie Brasco
Writer: Joseph D. Pistone (book), Richard Woodley (book), Paul Attanasio (screenplay)
Plot: An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 15 nominations.

Title: Donnie Darko
Plot: A troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes, after he narrowly escapes a bizarre accident.

Title: Edward Scissorhands
Writer: Tim Burton (story), Caroline Thompson (story), Caroline Thompson (screenplay)
Plot: An artificial man, who was incompletely constructed and has scissors for hands, leads a solitary life. Then one day, a suburban lady meets him and introduces him to her world.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 9 wins & 21 nominations.

Title: Fantastic Mr. Fox
Writer: Roald Dahl (novel), Wes Anderson (screenplay), Noah Baumbach (screenplay)
Plot: An urbane fox cannot resist returning to his farm raiding ways and then must help his community survive the farmers' retaliation.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 32 wins & 60 nominations.

Title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Writer: Charlie Kaufman (story), Michel Gondry (story), Pierre Bismuth (story), Charlie Kaufman (screenplay)
Plot: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories.

Title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
Writer: Hunter S. Thompson (book), Terry Gilliam (screenplay), Tony Grisoni (screenplay), Tod Davies (screenplay), Alex Cox (screenplay)
Plot: An oddball journalist and his psychopathic lawyer travel to Las Vegas for a series of psychedelic escapades.

Title: Fight Club
Plot: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soapmaker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 10 wins & 34 nominations.

Title: Following
Plot: A young writer who follows strangers for material meets a thief who takes him under his wing.

Title: Full Metal Jacket
Writer: Stanley Kubrick (screenplay by), Michael Herr (screenplay by), Gustav Hasford (screenplay by), Gustav Hasford (based on the novel "The Short Timers" by)
Plot: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 11 nominations.

Title: Festen
Plot: A young man is dead. We experience a moment from the night before, frozen in time.

Title: Godfather
Plot: Two youngsters from rival clans fall in love.

Title: Goodfellas
Writer: Nicholas Pileggi (book), Nicholas Pileggi (screenplay), Martin Scorsese (screenplay)
Plot: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.

Title: Groundhog Day
Writer: Danny Rubin (screenplay), Harold Ramis (screenplay), Danny Rubin (story)
Plot: A weatherman finds himself inexplicably living the same day over and over again.
Awards: Won 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 6 wins & 17 nominations.

Title: Go
Plot: Go! tells the story of the events after a drug deal, told from three different points of view.

Title: Hamlet
Plot: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarrying the murderer, his uncle. Meanwhile, war is brewing.
Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 9 wins & 20 nominations.

Title: Hero
Writer: Feng Li (screenplay), Yimou Zhang (screenplay), Bin Wang (screenplay)
Plot: A defense officer, Nameless, was summoned by the King of Qin regarding his success of terminating three warriors.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 37 wins & 39 nominations.

Title: Her
Plot: In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.

Title: In Bruges
Plot: Guilt-stricken after a job gone wrong, hitman Ray and his partner await orders from their ruthless boss in Bruges, Belgium, the last place in the world Ray wants to be.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 24 wins & 53 nominations.

Title: Howl's Moving Castle
Plot: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 14 wins & 19 nominations.

Title: Inglourious Basterds
Plot: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

Title: Interview with the Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles
Plot: A vampire tells his epic life story: love, betrayal, loneliness, and hunger.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 22 wins & 25 nominations.

Title: La Haine
Plot: 24 hours in the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot.

Title: Into the Wild
Plot: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 23 wins & 99 nominations.

Title: L.A. Confidential
Writer: James Ellroy (novel), Brian Helgeland (screenplay), Curtis Hanson (screenplay)
Plot: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen -- one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy -- investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.

Title: Meet the Feebles
Writer: Fran Walsh, Stephen Sinclair, Danny Mulheron, Peter Jackson
Plot: Multiple animals and insects experience the sleazier side of show business while working on a variety show.

Title: Mary and Max
Plot: A tale of friendship between two unlikely pen pals: Mary, a lonely, eight-year-old girl living in the suburbs of Melbourne, and Max, a forty-four-year old, severely obese man living in New York.

Title: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Plot: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.
Awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 13 wins & 7 nominations.

Title: Machete
Plot: After being set-up and betrayed by the man who hired him to assassinate a Texas Senator, an ex-Federale launches a brutal rampage of revenge against his former boss.

Title: Memento
Writer: Christopher Nolan (screenplay), Jonathan Nolan (short story "Memento Mori")
Plot: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 56 wins & 55 nominations.

Title: Michael Clayton
Plot: A law firm brings in its "fixer" to remedy the situation after a lawyer has a breakdown while representing a chemical company that he knows is guilty in a multibillion-dollar class action suit.

Title: Moonrise Kingdom
Plot: A pair of young lovers flee their New England town, which causes a local search party to fan out to find them.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 38 wins & 118 nominations.

Title: Melancholia
Plot: Two sisters find their already strained relationship challenged as a mysterious new planet threatens to collide with Earth.

Title: Mulholland Drive
Plot: After a car wreck on the winding Mulholland Drive renders a woman amnesiac, she and a perky Hollywood-hopeful search for clues and answers across Los Angeles in a twisting venture beyond dreams and reality.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 47 wins & 57 nominations.

Title: Naked Lunch
Plot: After developing an addiction to the substance he uses to kill bugs, an exterminator accidentally kills his wife, and becomes involved in a secret government plot being orchestrated by giant bugs in a port town in North Africa.

Title: The Nightmare Before Christmas
Writer: Tim Burton (story and characters), Michael McDowell (adaptation), Caroline Thompson (screenplay)
Plot: Jack Skellington, king of Halloween Town, discovers Christmas Town, but his attempts to bring Christmas to his home causes confusion.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 12 nominations.

Title: Nightcrawler
Plot: When Louis Bloom, a con man desperate for work, muscles into the world of L.A. crime journalism, he blurs the line between observer and participant to become the star of his own story.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 43 wins & 120 nominations.

Title: No Country for Old Men
Writer: Joel Coen (screenplay), Ethan Coen (screenplay), Cormac McCarthy (novel)
Plot: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

Title: Nocturnal Animals
Plot: A wealthy art gallery owner is haunted by her ex-husband's novel, a violent thriller she interprets as a symbolic revenge tale.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 16 wins & 133 nominations.

Title: Apocalypse Now
Writer: John Milius, Francis Ford Coppola, Michael Herr (narration)
Plot: During the Vietnam War, Captain Willard is sent on a dangerous mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade Colonel who has set himself up as a god among a local tribe.

Title: Only God Forgives
Plot: Julian, a drug-smuggler thriving in Bangkok's criminal underworld, sees his life get even more complicated when his mother compels him to find and kill whoever is responsible for his brother's recent death.

Title: Orgazmo
Plot: Naive young Mormon Joe Young is recruited to act in porn movies.

Title: Drive
Plot: A mysterious Hollywood stuntman and mechanic moonlights as a getaway driver and finds himself in trouble when he helps out his neighbor.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 77 wins & 170 nominations.

Title: City of God
Plot: In the slums of Rio, two kids' paths diverge as one struggles to become a photographer and the other a kingpin.
Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 66 wins & 38 nominations.

Title: Papillon
Writer: Dalton Trumbo (screenplay), Lorenzo Semple Jr. (screenplay), Henri Charrière (book)
Plot: A man befriends a fellow criminal as the two of them begin serving their sentence on a dreadful prison island, which inspires the man to plot his escape.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 1 nomination.

Title: Pi
Writer: Darren Aronofsky, Darren Aronofsky (story), Sean Gullette (story), Eric Watson (story), Darren Aronofsky (voice over written by), Sean Gullette (voice over written by)
Plot: A paranoid mathematician searches for a key number that will unlock the universal patterns found in nature.

Title: Persepolis
Plot: A precocious and outspoken Iranian girl grows up during the Islamic Revolution.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 28 wins & 54 nominations.

Title: Planet Terror
Plot: After an experimental bio-weapon is released, turning thousands into zombie-like creatures, it's up to a rag-tag group of survivors to stop the infected and those behind its release.

Title: Platoon
Plot: A young soldier in Vietnam faces a moral crisis when confronted with the horrors of war and the duality of man.

Title: Requiem for a Dream
Writer: Hubert Selby Jr. (based on the book by), Hubert Selby Jr. (screenplay), Darren Aronofsky (screenplay)
Plot: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 33 wins & 62 nominations.

Title: Princess Mononoke
Writer: Hayao Miyazaki, Neil Gaiman (adapted by: English version)
Plot: On a journey to find the cure for a Tatarigami's curse, Ashitaka finds himself in the middle of a war between the forest gods and Tatara, a mining colony. In this quest he also meets San, the Mononoke Hime.

Title: Reservoir Dogs
Writer: Quentin Tarantino, Quentin Tarantino (background radio dialogue written by), Roger Avary (background radio dialogue written by)
Plot: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

Title: Pulp Fiction
Writer: Quentin Tarantino (stories), Roger Avary (stories), Quentin Tarantino
Plot: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

Title: Sleepers
Plot: After a prank goes disastrously wrong, a group of boys are sent to a detention center where they are brutalized. Thirteen years later, they get their chance for revenge.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 1 win & 4 nominations.

Title: Sin City
Plot: A film that explores the dark and miserable town, Basin City, and tells the story of three different people, all caught up in violent corruption.

Title: Snatch
Plot: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

Title: Spirited Away
Plot: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.

Title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
Plot: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the mysterious Darth Vader.

Title: Spring Breakers
Plot: Four college girls hold up a restaurant in order to fund their spring break vacation. While partying, drinking, and taking drugs, they are arrested, only to be bailed out by a drug and arms dealer.

Title: Team America: World Police
Writer: Trey Parker, Matt Stone, Pam Brady
Plot: Popular Broadway actor Gary Johnston is recruited by the elite counter-terrorism organization Team America: World Police. As the world begins to crumble around him, he must battle with terrorists, celebrities and falling in love.

Title: Thank You for Smoking
Plot: Satirical comedy follows the machinations of Big Tobacco's chief spokesman, Nick Naylor, who spins on behalf of cigarettes while trying to remain a role model for his twelve-year-old son.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 12 wins & 30 nominations.

Title: The Departed
Writer: William Monahan (screenplay), Alan Mak, Felix Chong
Plot: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.

Title: The Hateful Eight
Plot: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

Title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
Writer: Luciano Vincenzoni (story), Sergio Leone (story), Agenore Incrocci (screenplay), Furio Scarpelli (screenplay), Luciano Vincenzoni (screenplay), Sergio Leone (screenplay)
Plot: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.

Title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Writer: Douglas Adams (book), Douglas Adams (screenplay), Karey Kirkpatrick (screenplay)
Plot: Mere seconds before the Earth is to be demolished by an alien construction crew, journeyman Arthur Dent is swept off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher penning a new edition of "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy."

Title: The Machinist
Plot: An industrial worker who hasn't slept in a year begins to doubt his own sanity.

Title: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
Plot: Steven, a charismatic surgeon, is forced to make an unthinkable sacrifice after his life starts to fall apart, when the behavior of a teenage boy he has taken under his wing turns sinister.

Title: The Matrix
Plot: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.

Title: Se7en
Plot: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 25 wins & 33 nominations.

Title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
Writer: Stefan Zweig (inspired by the writings of), Wes Anderson (screenplay), Wes Anderson (story), Hugo Guinness (story)
Plot: The adventures of Gustave H, a legendary concierge at a famous hotel from the fictional Republic of Zubrowka between the first and second World Wars, and Zero Moustafa, the lobby boy who becomes his most trusted friend.

Title: The Thing
Writer: Bill Lancaster (screenplay), John W. Campbell Jr. (story)
Plot: A research team in Antarctica is hunted by a shape-shifting alien that assumes the appearance of its victims.

Title: Trainspotting
Writer: Irvine Welsh (based on the novel by), John Hodge (screenplay)
Plot: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 23 wins & 33 nominations.

Title: True Romance
Plot: In Detroit, a lonely pop culture geek marries a call girl, steals cocaine from her pimp, and tries to sell it in Hollywood. Meanwhile, the owners of the cocaine, the Mob, track them down in an attempt to reclaim it.

Title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
Plot: Two girlfriends on a summer holiday in Spain become enamored with the same painter, unaware that his ex-wife, with whom he has a tempestuous relationship, is about to re-enter the picture.

Title: Pan's Labyrinth
Plot: In the Falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

Title: The Devil's Advocate
Writer: Andrew Neiderman (novel), Jonathan Lemkin (screenplay), Tony Gilroy (screenplay)
Plot: An exceptionally adept Florida lawyer is offered a job at a high-end New York City law firm with a high-end boss - the biggest opportunity of his career to date.

Title: Mother!
Plot: A couple's relationship is tested when uninvited guests arrive at their home, disrupting their tranquil existence.

Title: Videodrome
Plot: When he acquires a different kind of show for his station, a sleazy cable-TV programmer begins to see his life and the future of media spin out of control in a terrifying new reality.

Title: Run Lola Run
Plot: After a botched money delivery, Lola has 20 minutes to come up with 100,000 Deutschmarks.
Awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 28 wins & 19 nominations.
